originalText.text: I shared earlier in another review that the hand sanitizer dispenser on the 6th floor was not clean. But on my recent visit to the facility, I  was happy to see a new dispenser in place of the old one. Someone is actually reading the reviews.

text.text: I shared earlier in another review that the hand sanitizer dispenser on the 6th floor was not clean. But on my recent visit to the facility, I  was happy to see a new dispenser in place of the old one. Someone is actually reading the reviews.

originalText.text:
Reading these roller coaster reviews makes you wonder.  My friend is on the ninth floor. It appears from the reviews that each floor has a different level of professionalism and cleanliness The 9th  floor is chaotic and inefficient. My friend has  been there for two weeks. His nurse still doesn’t know his name. My  reaction towards the staff has not been entirely thoughtful either for that I apologize. But it’s very difficult to maintain levelheadedness when your loved one is in a situation that is lacking dignity and respect.
I like to add to this review by stating the physical therapist and vocational therapist and speech therapist have all been excellent

I like to add to this review by stating the physical therapist and vocational therapist and speech therapist have all been excellent

originalText.text: Simply stated about my mom rehab program at this center - I have been visited her daily for more than three weeks. The caregivers and staff are wonderful and thoughtful.

text.text: Simply stated about my mom rehab program at this center - I have been visited her daily for more than three weeks. The caregivers and staff are wonderful and thoughtful.

originalText.text: The staff on the 11th floor are all great. Very helpful and caring. They encourage my mother in all aspects of her care. She has made great strides in her rehab and has gained strength which is fantastic. She is in good spirits because the staff are friendly and really care about the patients. I also see that it isn’t just patients who have visitors. They are attentive to patients who have no one with them. They always stop in just to check the other patient in the room. The facility is older but it is clean. My mom has been able to sit outside and stop by the cafe in the lobby. It has been a great experience

originalText.text:
Brace yourself! This place has rats. Big ones, baby ones and all sizes! They have given their residents sticky traps and have placed them all over the floor in the building.
These rodents are living and are running all around the floor and even on the residents beds and pillow! How unsanitary and disgusting is that?
When I spoke with the dietitian about any in the kitchen, she said she did not see any! Now that shocked me. But, I could tell by her tone that she wanted me off the phone and wanted to keep off the topic. But, then again, it’s not her loved one, at that nursing home, eating that food. I am wondering why after several months of this going on and everyone knowing this, why it is that they are still not admitting to the problem and these poor elderly people are silenced. They are short staffed when the CNA  leaves and the residents suffer. The food is awful according to most residents. The menu is terrible! The don’t even give their residents anything special on holidays. Maybe Thanksgiving.
No fruit salad. You must like a whole banana or orange. These people are elderly? I don’t get why they can’t get fruit salad??
Mostly, for more than half a year there are big rodents, little rodents and all sizes inside the facility roaming the halls, bathrooms, beds, everywhere. During the day too! Geez, just come and see for yourself.
People in Harrisburg and Albany, you’re welcome to come and see for yourself what a disgrace this place has become.
Not fit for anyone’s parents, grandparents, neighbor, friend, uncle, aunt, or human to be living with a rat family.
Concerned & worried family member
